intro: Kali monopterum, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive net-like pattern on the underside, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found growing in moist, shaded areas. Kali monopterum is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
